photo.description: As evidenced by the Taj Mahal, Emperor Shah Jahan preferred a more refined style of architecture with detailed designs on shimmering white marble. The other two inner and outer palace structures in the Agra Fort belong to him.

photo.description: Agra Fort is a UNESCO World Heritage site located in Agra, India. The fort is also known as Lal Qila, Fort Rouge and Red Fort of Agra. It's one of those monuments that is left out of the spotlight due to the popularity of other monuments. The Taj Mahal is a beautiful and wonderful construction, but the Red Fort of Agra contains so much more history. Check out my travelblog at <a href"http:www.175days.no" rel"nofollow">www.175days.no<a>

photo.description: Agra Fort is one of the world heritage sites in Agra, also known as Red Fort for its walls of red bricks. A walled city, not fully accessible to the public, but what can be seen is impressive enough! We will go inside a little later, for now some views from outside. It is very nicely restored and more impressive than the fort of Delhi.
photo.title: Agra Fort

photo.description: Agra Fort is one of the world heritage sites in Agra, also known as Red Fort for its walls of red bricks. A walled city, not fully accessible to the public, but what can be seen is impressive enough! We will go inside a little later, for now some views from outside. It is very nicely restored and more impressive than the fort of Delhi.
photo.title: Agra Fort

photo.description: Agra Fort is one of the world heritage sites in Agra, also known as Red Fort for its walls of red bricks. A walled city, not fully accessible to the public, but what can be seen is impressive enough! We will go inside a little later, for now some views from outside. It is very nicely restored and more impressive than the fort of Delhi. And these nice guys to the left and right want to sell you something quite aggressively. It's like this at all tourist spots of India ... (Right outside the entrance, they are not allowed inside.)

A walled city, not fully accessible to the public, but what can be seen is impressive enough! We will go inside a little later, for now some views from outside. It is very nicely restored and more impressive than the fort of Delhi.

photo.title: Agra Fort

photo.description: Agra Fort is a UNESCO World Heritage site located in Agra, India. The fort is also known as Lal Qila, Fort Rouge and Red Fort of Agra. It's one of those monuments that is left out of the spotlight due to the popularity of other monuments. The Taj Mahal is a beautiful and wonderful construction, but the Red Fort of Agra contains so much more history. Check out my travelblog at <a href"http:www.175days.no" rel"nofollow">www.175days.no<a>
photo.title: Squirrel at Agra Red Fort

photo.description: The first of three major palace complexes within the fort is a section designed by Ackbar with his signature red sandstone and multi-culturalreligious motifs.
photo.title: Agra Fort

photo.description: This great fort acted as both a defensive structure as well as a palace structure for the Mughal Emperors while their capital was seated in Agra. Best known for Ackbar and Shah Jahan's palace structures at the height of Mughal power.
photo.title: Agra Fort

photo.description: We bumped into our train buddy at the fort

photo.description: This was Sha Jahan's personal room, at first where he would retire to rest after the hard work of rule. Later, where his son held him captive for years until his death.
photo.title: Agra Fort

photo.description: Built of red sandstone, Agra Fort combines Hindu and Islamic architecture. Agra Fort is a UNESCO World Heritage site located in Agra near the famous Taj Mahal. This walled cityfort was fortified at various stages by the Mughal emporors Humayun, Akbar, Jehangir, Shah Jahan and Aurangzeb.
photo.title: Agra Fort

photo.description: Agra Fort, is a monument, a UNESCO World Heritage site located in Agra, Uttar Pradesh, India. It is about 2.5 km northwest of its more famous sister monument, the Taj Mahal. The fort can be more accurately described as a walled city.

photo.description: The famous Red Fort in Agra, India. Built by Shah Jahan, who had to spend the last years of life imprisoned here, after being dethroned by his son Aurangzeb. The Diwan-I-Am (Hall of public audience) built 1628 to 1635. Similar structures, also built under Shah Jahan, are in Delhi and Lahore.
photo.title: Agra Fort

photo.description: Built of red sandstone, Agra Fort combines Hindu and Islamic architecture. Agra Fort is a UNESCO World Heritage site located in Agra near the famous Taj Mahal. This walled cityfort was fortified at various stages by the Mughal emporors Humayun, Akbar, Jehangir, Shah Jahan and Aurangzeb.
photo.title: Moat around Agra Fort

The big soup cup in Agra Fort :p
A view from the back of Agra Fort
A view of Taj Mahal from Agra Fort

photo.description: The Red Fort in Agra was filled with huge open spaces, green grass and immpressive buildings, a definite must visit when in Agra! Agra Fort is a UNESCO World Heritage site located in Agra, India. The fort is also known as Lal Qila, Fort Rouge and Red Fort of Agra. It's one of those monuments that is left out of the spotlight due to the popularity of other monuments. The Taj Mahal is a beautiful and wonderful construction, but the Red Fort of Agra contains so much more history. Check out my travelblog at <a href"http:www.175days.no" rel"nofollow">www.175days.no<a>
